title: Subagent orchestration for parallel epic development
description:
Enable TUI to orchestrate multiple parallel Claude sessions working on related tasks (e.g., epic children). Each worker runs in its own worktree/tmux session. Coordination via Agent Mail for real-time updates, beads for persistent state.

**Key Features:**
1. Space+o on epic ‚Üí orchestration mode showing child tasks
2. Select which tasks to parallelize
3. Spawn workers (worktree + tmux + claude per task)
4. Workers get injected context about epic and coordination rules
5. Real-time progress tracking via Agent Mail status broadcasts
6. Epic progress bar showing X/Y tasks complete
7. Optional orchestrator Claude for planning/review phases

**Architecture:**
- TUI is external orchestrator (not a Claude subagent)
- Workers are independent Claude sessions
- Agent Mail handles: reservations, status, completion signals
- Beads handles: persistent notes, design decisions
- Graceful degradation to git-only if Agent Mail unavailable

**New UI:**
- Orchestration mode (Space+o)
- Epic progress indicator (‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñë‚ñë 3/5)
- Indented child tasks under epic
- Worker status in session indicators

**Session Templates:**
- worker.md template with epic context injection
- Coordination rules (stay focused, report discoveries)
- Auto-close task on completion
notes:
Session 2025-12-12: Designed from Claude Code best practices research.

RESEARCH VALIDATION:
- Pattern confirmed: Git worktrees are de facto standard for parallel AI agents (Cursor, ccswarm, Claude-Flow all use this)
- Key insight: TUI as external orchestrator avoids Claude subagent nesting limits
- Agent Mail provides <100ms coordination vs 2-5s git sync

ARCHITECTURE DECISIONS:
- TUI spawns workers (not Claude spawning subagents) - no nesting limits
- Each worker: worktree + tmux session + Claude instance
- Agent Mail for: reservations, status broadcasts, completion signals  
- Beads for: persistent notes, design decisions
- Graceful degradation to git-only if Agent Mail unavailable

UI DESIGN:
- Space+o triggers orchestration mode on epics
- Reuse select mode patterns for task selection
- Progress bar: ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñë‚ñë 3/5 format
- Indented children under epics in board view

- az-l7a (Agent Mail epic) ‚Üí az-2il (status broadcasts)

title: FileLockManager - prevent concurrent file access
description: Implement socket-based file locking to prevent multiple Claude sessions from editing the same file simultaneously.
notes:
Implemented FileLockManager service following Effect patterns:

Core implementation:
- Service defined using Effect.Tag pattern (FileLockManager)
- Lock types: exclusive (write) vs shared (read)
- Error types: LockError, LockTimeoutError, LockConflictError
- Lock state tracking via Ref<HashMap<Path, LockState>>

Key methods:
- acquireLock(path, type, timeout?, sessionId?): acquires lock or waits in queue
- releaseLock(lock): releases lock and processes wait queue
- getLockState(path): inspection for debugging/monitoring
- withLock(options, effect): scoped convenience function for automatic cleanup

Lock semantics:
- Exclusive locks: only one holder, blocks all other locks
- Shared locks: multiple holders allowed, blocks exclusive locks
- Wait queue processing: FIFO with automatic grant when compatible

Features:
- Effect.ensuring for automatic lock release
- Deferred + timeoutFail for timeout handling
- Automatic wait queue cleanup on fiber interruption
- Path normalization for consistent lock granularity
- Project hash for socket paths: /tmp/azedarach-<hash>.sock

Files created:
- src/core/FileLockManager.ts (580 lines)
- src/core/FileLockManager.example.ts (354 lines with 8 examples)

Type checking: CLEAN (no errors)
Follows patterns from: TmuxService, WorktreeManager, StateDetector

title: Allow creating beads via Claude prompt with persistent session
description:
Enable users to create new beads from within azedarach by sending a natural language prompt to Claude.

## Requirements
- User provides a description of the task/feature they want to create
- Claude interprets the prompt and creates the appropriate bead (title, type, description, etc.)
- The tmux session used for bead creation should persist after creation
- This allows the user to immediately start working on the newly created bead in the same session

## Use Case
Instead of manually running `bd create`, user can describe what they need in natural language from within azedarach's TUI, and Claude handles the bead creation. The persistent session means they can seamlessly transition from "create this task" to "now work on it".

title: PRWorkflow - automated GitHub PR creation
description:
Automate PR creation when tasks complete using gh CLI.

Design:
- Define PRWorkflow as Effect.Service
- Depends on: SessionManager, WorktreeManager, BeadsClient, Config
- Use @effect/platform Command for git and gh CLI operations

Methods:
  - createPR(beadId): Effect<PR, PRError | GitError>
  - getPR(beadId): Effect<PR | null, PRError>
  - mergePR(prNumber): Effect<void, PRError>
  - cleanup(beadId): Effect<void, GitError> -- NEW

Workflow on "done" state:
  1. bd sync (via BeadsClient)
  2. git add -A && git commit
  3. git push -u origin <branch>
  4. gh pr create --draft --title "..." --body "..."

PR body template includes bead description, acceptance criteria.
Link PR back to bead via bd update --notes.
Use Effect.retry with Schedule for transient failures.

**Cleanup after merge:**
  1. Ensure session is stopped
  2. WorktreeManager.remove() - delete worktree directory
  3. git push origin --delete <branch> - delete remote branch
  4. git branch -D <branch> - delete local branch
  5. bd close <beadId> - mark task complete

This cleanup function will also be exposed for manual use (az-6t6).

title: Agent Mail Integration for Multi-Agent Coordination
description:
Implement Agent Mail coordination layer for multi-agent beads workflows. Agent Mail reduces coordination latency from 2-5 seconds (git sync) to <100ms (HTTP API), preventing work collisions when multiple Claude sessions operate simultaneously.

Key benefits:
- 20-50x faster coordination than git sync
- Prevents duplicate work through exclusive file reservations
- Lightweight (~50MB memory footprint)
- Optional with graceful degradation to git-only

Integration points:
1. Issue reservation before starting work
2. Issue release when work completes
3. Ready query to find unblocked, unreserved issues
4. Status updates for real-time visibility

Configuration:
- BEADS_AGENT_MAIL_URL: Server endpoint
- BEADS_AGENT_NAME: Unique agent identifier
- BEADS_PROJECT_ID: Shared namespace

Reference: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/AGENT_MAIL.md

title: Integrate Agent Mail with SessionManager
description:
Wire Agent Mail into session lifecycle for automatic reservation management.

Design:
- SessionManager.start() calls agentMail.reserve() before worktree creation
- SessionManager.stop() calls agentMail.release() after cleanup
- SessionManager.pause() keeps reservation but updates status
- Add reservation info to Session type
- Fail session start if issue already reserved by another agent
- Handle reservation conflicts gracefully
- Update Kanban board to show reservation status (who owns what)
